result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah L. Wood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI Cause Injury (2+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Review hearing on 2/12/16 @ 9am.  P&P to provide written report by 2/10/16.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay fine of $400 and court costs including all applicable surcharges - bond to apply.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Review hearing on 2/12/16 @ 9am.  P&P to provide written report by 2/10/16.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.
****
***JOC IS AMENDED AS FOLLOWS:   COURT WILL ORDER THAT THE DEPT. OF CORRECTIONS MAY NOT IMPOSE OR FORCE AN IID REQUIREMENT W/O PERMISSION OF THE COURT.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed.
It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the sheriff under the Statutes.
Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a conditon of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Laura Walker.  Arguments heard on deft's motion to terminate probation early.  Motion to terminate probation is denied.  However, Court will order that the Dept of Corrections may not impose or force an IID requirement w/o permission of the court.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Laura Walker.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 3yrs.  See conditions.  Deft sentenced to 60 days KCJ as a condition of probation.  To commence 10/10/15 @ 6pm.  Huber allowed.  It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.  DL revoked for 14mos.  IID ordered for 14mos.  RH set for 2/12/16 @ 9am.  Alcohol assesment ordered.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.
WCS - compliant

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Laura Walker.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance; victim present - statement made.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 10/5/15 @ 1:30pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Laura Walker.  Subst. of counsel filed.  Atty Walker retained in place of Atty Koesser.  Atty Koesser is allowed to w/draw.  Atty Koesser provided discovery to Atty Laura Walker in court.  Defense moves for bond reduction.  State objects.  Court denies bond motion.  Bond to continue.
